newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bomb kills one, wounds 13 in Algeria.
newsitem.headline: Bomb kills one, wounds 13 in Algeria.

text.p: A bomb explosion killed one man and wounded 13 others in a small town near Algiers, the official APS news agency said on Monday.

The explosion, around midday on Saturday in Berroughia, came less than a week before Algerians vote on constitutional changes. Guerrillas, who want to disrupt the Thursday referendum, have warned people to stay at home.
Although the government insists the poll will be held in "full freedom and tranquility," violence continued unabated in the days before the poll.

A car bomb killed five people and wounded 19 on Sunday in the central garrison town of Blida, newspapers said on Monday. Security forces killed nine guerrillas in two operations in the previous 24 hours near Algiers, newspapers also reported.
About 60,000 people have been killed in Algeria since early 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists had taken a huge lead.
